intro: Daphnopsis guaiquinimae, commonly known as the Guaiquinimae daphnopsis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and compact growth habit. The plant typically features small, leathery leaves arranged in whorls around the stem, and its flowers are usually white or pale pink, clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical species.
